definition[0]: to buy someone’s share of a business or property that you previously owned together, so that you have complete control
definition[1]: to pay money so that someone can leave an organization such as the army before their contract has ended
definition[2]: to buy all of someone’s shares in a business that you previously owned together, giving you complete control
example[0]: They plan to buy out the shares of all the other shareholders.
example[1]: staff who had tried to buy out the company to keep it working
